_header: In our gospel Saint Luke says us / That mickle folk come to Jesu
_description: Gospel for Sexagesima Sunday, in the Northern Homily Cycle

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
IN vr gospel seint Luc seiþ vsÞat muche folk com to
                    Ihesus…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Of Mekenesse I wol ȝow telleA tale ȝif ȝe wol
                    here my spelle
BodEngPoeta1.Attributed Title:
Cum turba phirima conuenerient & de ciuita (f.
                    179va)
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodAsh42.First Lines:
In oure gospell saynte luke saise vsþat mani folk come to
                    iesus…
BodAsh42.Last Lines:
…Of tholemudenes will i ȝow tellA tale if ȝe will
                    here my spell
BodAsh42.Editions:
Thompson,  Anne B.,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Homily
                    Cycle.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008.

CULAdd8335.First Lines:
IN oure godspelle seynt Luk telles vsÞat mekil folk come til
                    ihesus…
CULAdd8335.Last Lines:
…Nowe ihesu crist oure heuene kyngTo þat grete blisse vs
                    alle þou bryng Amen

CULDd11.First Lines:
IN oure Gospel seynt Luke seyth þusÞat moche folk cam vn
                    to ihesus…
CULDd11.Last Lines:
…And of mekenesse I wile now telle A tale if ȝe wile
                    herin my spelle
CULDd11.Attributed Title:
Dominica in lxa Euangelium secundum Lucam cao octavo Cum turba multa
                        conuenirent & de ciuitatibus & c. (f. 83)

CULGg531.First Lines:
In oure gospell sayn luke says vsÞat mekill folk come to
                    ihesus…
CULGg531.Last Lines:
…Of tholmondnes wyll I ȝou tellA tall if ȝe wyll
                    here my spell
CULGg531.Attributed Title:
Dominica in sexagesima euangelium (f. 55, followed by 1 line Latin
                    scripture)

BLAdd38010.First Lines:
Ȝit our gospell saint luke sais þusThat mykill soth es
                    comen to ihesus…
BLAdd38010.Last Lines:
…Of tholemodnes I will you tellA tall if yhe will her my
                    spell

BLHar4196.First Lines: Oure godspell witnes vntill vsWhen many folk come to iesus…
BLHar4196.Last Lines: …þan sal we haue oure mede forþiGifen of god als es worthy
BLHar4196.Note: Preceded by Latin, “Cum turba plurima conuenirent & de civitatibus properarent ad ihesum.”
BLHar4196.Attributed Title: Dominica in sexagesima Secundum Lucam (rubric, f. 39vb)
BLHar4196.Editions:
Nevanlinna,  Sara. 
             The Northern Homily Cycle: The Expanded Version in MSS Harley 4196 and Cotton Tiberius E.vii.
             3 vols. 
             Memoires de la Societé Neophilologique de Helsinki.
         Helsinki. 38 (1972); 41 (1973); and 43 (1984): II.19-23.

MinULZ822.First Lines:
In oure gospell saynt luke says vsþat mykyll folke come to
                    ihesus…
MinULZ822.Last Lines:
…Off tholomenes I wyll ȝowe tellA tale yfe ȝe wyll
                    here me spell
